trans-unit.source: Represents an item in the XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model.
An item is either a node or an atomic value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem"></xref> class.
This constructor is called by derived class constructors to initialize state in this type.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the item represents an XPath node or an atomic value.
`true` if the item represents an XPath node; `false` if the item represents an atomic value.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the current item as a boxed object of the most appropriate [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] type according to its schema type.

If the value of the item is not valid according to its specified schema type, the value of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.TypedValue%2A> property is equivalent to the value of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.Value%2A> property.

For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=fullName> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).
The current item as a boxed object of the most appropriate [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] type.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the `string` value of the item.
The `string` value of the item.
Returns the item's value as the specified type.

When overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAs%2A> method attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] type specified.
The type to return the item value as.
The value of the item as the type requested.
The item's value is not in the correct format for the target type.
The attempted cast is not valid.
The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.
When overridden in a derived class, returns the item's value as the type specified using the <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver"></xref> object specified to resolve namespace prefixes.

When overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAs%2A> method attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] type specified.
The <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> object is used to resolve namespace prefixes related to type conversions.
For example, when converting an `xs:QName` to an `xs:string`.

For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=fullName> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).
The type to return the item's value as.
The <xref href="System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver"></xref> object used to resolve namespace prefixes.
The value of the item as the type requested.
The item's value is not in the correct format for the target type.
The attempted cast is not valid.
The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAsDateTime%2A> property attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] <xref:System.Boolean> type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=fullName> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).
The item's value as a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref>.
The item's value is not in the correct format for the <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> type.
The attempted cast to <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> is not valid.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAsDateTime%2A> property attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] <xref:System.DateTime> type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=fullName> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).
The item's value as a <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref>.
The item's value is not in the correct format for the <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> type.
The attempted cast to <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> is not valid.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAsDouble%2A> property attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] <xref:System.Double> type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=fullName> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).
The item's value as a <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
The item's value is not in the correct format for the <xref href="System.Double"></xref> type.
The attempted cast to <xref href="System.Double"></xref> is not valid.
The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAsInt%2A> property attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] <xref:System.Int32> type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=fullName> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).
The item's value as an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
The item's value is not in the correct format for the <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> type.
The attempted cast to <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> is not valid.
The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as an <xref href="System.Int64"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAsLong%2A> property attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] <xref:System.Int64> type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=fullName> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).
The item's value as an <xref href="System.Int64"></xref>.
The item's value is not in the correct format for the <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> type.
The attempted cast to <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> is not valid.
The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] type of the item.
When overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueType%2A> property gets the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] type of the typed value of the item.
For example, an element of type `xs:int` would have a <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueType%2A> of <xref:System.Int32> by default.
However, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueType%2A> could be any one of the valid types that can be mapped to `xs:int`, such as <xref:System.Int16> or <xref:System.Double>.

For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=fullName> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).
The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] type of the item.
The default value is <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType"></xref> for the item.
When overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.XmlType%2A> property gets the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType> for the item.
For example, the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType> or <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaComplexType>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType"></xref> for the item.
